@coffeekraken.sugar.js.keyboard.hotkey.name: hotkey
@coffeekraken.sugar.js.keyboard.hotkey.description:
Simple function to add a hotkey like "ctrl+a" and an handler function that will be called when the hotkey has been pressed
The following keys are supported:
- shift, option, alt, ctrl, control, command
- backspace, tab, clear, enter, return, esc, escape, space, up, down, left, right, home, end, pageup, pagedown, del, delete
- from f1 to f19
- all the letters keys

You can pass an option object to your hotkey function call.

@coffeekraken.sugar.node.dependencies.de.name: dependenciesHash
@coffeekraken.sugar.node.dependencies.de.description:
This function take as input an object that follows the structure described in the example bellow.
With that, if will recursively (for files dependencies) load them, check if they have some dependencies,
and create a hash depending on all of that.
Here's the process steps:
1. Check the files dependencies.
2. If their's, load recursively these dependencies and start the process over them again
3. Create a hash for the current dependency with using all non "files" dependencies as well as the file updated timestamp
4. Make this process recursively until all the "files" have been processed
5. Return the final hash for your dependency object

This function simply take as parameter a glob (or array of globs) pattern(s)
and return an SPromise instance through which you can subscribe to events like:
- ready: Emitted once the pool is ready
- file: Emitted for each file founded, added or updated
- files: Emitted with a list of founded files
- change: Emitted when a file has been updated (alias to update)
- update: Emitted when a file has been updated
- unlink: Emitted when a file has been deleted
- add: Emitted when a file has been added

@coffeekraken.sugar.js.cli.buildCommandL.name: buildCommandLine
@coffeekraken.sugar.js.cli.buildCommandL.description:
This function takes as parameters a command line (with tokens), an arguments object and a definition object to
generate the final command line string to launch.
A token is simply a string that begin with "[" and end with "]" like so: "[mytoken]".
Each arguments of the definition object can be a token. If you have an argument called "hostname", the corresponding token will be "[hostname]".
A special token called "[arguments]" is needed if you want the passed arguments to be integrated to the builded command line.

and convert it into the wanted format like "rgba", "hsl", "hsv", "hex", "rgbaString", "hslString" or "hsvString"

example.code:
import convert from '@coffeekraken/sugar/js/color/convert';
convert('rgba(10,20,30,100)', 'rgba'); // => { r: 10, g: 20, b: 30, a: 100 }

@coffeekraken.sugar.js.core.activeSpace.name: activeSpace
@coffeekraken.sugar.js.core.activeSpace.description:
This object expose some functions that are usefull to manage the "active" space of your application.
An active space is represented by a string formated like so "something.cool.hello". This mean that your app is
in the "something.cool.hello" space and depending on that, you can enable or disable some features like for example
keypress that have to be active only in certain "space" of your application.
The exposed functions are these ones:
- set: This allows you to set the active space
- get: This allows you to get the current active space
- is: This allows you to check if the passed active space string is in the current active space
- previous: This allows you to go back 1 activeSpace in the stack
- on: This allows you to register callbacks attached to an activeSpace
- append: This allows you to append an activeSpace string to the current one

get.name: get
get.description: This function allows you to get the current active space

set.name: set
set.description: This function allows you to set the current active space

append.name: append
append.description: This function take the current activeSpace string and add the passed one to set the new activeSpace string

remove.name: remove
remove.description: This function simply remove the passed string from the activeSpace stack

previous.name: previous
previous.description: This function simply go back by 1 in the activeSpace stack

is.name: is
is.description:
This function allows you to check if the active space string that you pass match with the current active space or not.
The checking process is done using the "minimatch" package that let you use cool features like "", "**", etc...

on.name: on
on.description:
This function allows you to register a callback linked with an activeSpace string
that will be called once the activeSpace is matched

This class represent an es6 import statement with properties like:

as something from ..."

example.code:

founded es6 imports

default.name: default
default.description: Store the statement default import name

star.name: star
star.description:
Store the statement star name like "import
as coco from ..."

named.name: named
named.description:
Store the statement named imports with these properties:
- name {String}: The import name
- as {String}: The import as alias

@coffeekraken.sugar.shared.function.ease.name: easeInterval
@coffeekraken.sugar.shared.function.ease.description:
This function allows you to call a callback function exactly as the `setInterval` would do but with an easing that you can specify,
as well as an `interval` setting to customize how many time your function will be called.
By default this function will pass the "easedPercent" that represent the percentage of your passed "duration" with the easing applied on it.
With that you can make everything you want inside your callback function.

This function simply take a package.json JSON formatted object and standardize
some fields like the "author" one to be sure it is an object at the end,
the "contributors" array the same way as the "author" one, etc... Here's the list
of processed actions:
1. Transform the string version of the "author" field into an object with the properties "name", "email" and "url"
2. Transform the string version of the "contributors" field into an object with the properties "name", "email" and "url"

@coffeekraken.sugar.js.object.deepProxy.name: deepProxy
@coffeekraken.sugar.js.object.deepProxy.description:
This function allows you to add Proxy to an object in deep fashion.
Normally the Proxy process only the level on which it has been added. Here we add Proxy to all the
object levels and to new properties as well.

On the returned proxied object, you will have access to the ```revoke``` method that you can call to revoke the proxy applied.
This method will return you a shallow version of the proxied object that you can use as you want

@coffeekraken.sugar.js.url.parseSchema.name: parseSchema
@coffeekraken.sugar.js.url.parseSchema.description:
This function take two arguments. The first one is the url to parse and the second is a schema to scan the url with.
The schema describe the pathname of an url and tell's how to analyze it.
Here's a little description with some example of schemas:
- "{param1}/{param2}/{param3}": This schema describe that your Url must have 3 "values" named param1, param2 and param3
- If my Url is "something.com/hello/world/plop", my schema is respected and I can have access to the values through the "schema.params.param1", "schema.params.param2", etc...
- "{hello:string}/{world:number}/{?idx:number}": This schema describe that the Url can have 3 "values" but the last one is optional
- If my Url is "something.com/plop/3/1", my schema is respected
- If my Url is "something.com/plop/2", my schema is respected
- If my Url is "something.com/plop/hello/2", my schema is not respected due to the fact that the param named "world" has to be a number

@coffeekraken.sugar.js.value.typeof.name: typeof
@coffeekraken.sugar.js.value.typeof.description:
This function return the correct type of the passed value.
It support the recognition of arrays and return 'Array' as property type.
You can olso ask the function to gives you the "of" types of the passed value. This mean that if you
pass an Array like so "[10,'Hello',true]" and that you ask for "of" types, it will returns you
"Array<Integer|String|Boolean>".
Another feature is to ask the result as an object like so:
{
type: 'Array',
of: ['Integer','String','Boolean']
}
You can ask also the typeof function to returns you the actual class name if the passed value is an instance
of an custom class.

@coffeekraken.s-log.shared.sLog.name: SLog
@coffeekraken.s-log.shared.sLog.description:
This class represent a log that can be make across the application using the "emit"
function of an SPromise instance for example. It has as goal to centralize and harmonize
what a log can be and can do.
Each log is specified by some characteristic like a "type" that can be something like "SLog.LOG" or "SLog.WARN".
It has also the possibility to unactivate some logs depending on different cisronstances like for example the
fact to set the `SLog.filter([SLog.WARN, SLog.ERROR])` to only let the warn and error logs
activated.

lOG.name: LOG
lOG.description: This static constant tells a log that it is of type "LOG"

iNFO.name: INFO
iNFO.description: This static constant tells a log that it is of type "INFO"

wARN.name: WARN
wARN.description: This static constant tells a log that it is of type "WARN"

eRROR.name: ERROR
eRROR.description: This static constant tells a log that it is of type "ERROR"

vERBOSE.name: VERBOSE
vERBOSE.description: This static constant tells a log that it is of type "VERBOSE"

cHILDPROCESS.name: CHILD_PROCESS
cHILDPROCESS.description: This static constant tells a log that it is of type "CHILD_PROCESS"

filter.name: filter
filter.description:
This static method allows you to filter the logs across your entire app
at once. To do this, simply name your filter and pass an object describing
what you want to apply as filter.
These filters will have as consequence to set the "active" property of each logs to
true or false.

clearFilters.name: clearFilters
clearFilters.description: This static method allows you to reset all the filters applied

removeFilter.name: removeFilter
removeFilter.description: This static method allows you to remove a particular filter by its name

setDefaultLogObj.name: setDefaultLogObj
setDefaultLogObj.description:
This static method allows you to set a default log object
above every others will be extended.

value.name: value
value.description: Access the "value" property of the SLog object

type.name: type
type.description:
Access the "type" property of the SLog object
This specify which type if the log. LOG, INFO, WARN, ERROR or VERBODE

active.name: active
active.description:
Access the "active" property of the SLog object
This specify if the log is active depending on parameters like `SLog.filter`.
Check the documentation of this static method for more info.

decorators.name: decorators
decorators.description:
Access the "decorators" property of the SLog object.
This specify if the log has to be printed with decorators or not

time.name: time
time.description:
Access the "time" property of the SLog object.
This specify if the log has to be printed with his time or not

timestamp.name: timestamp
timestamp.description: Access the "timestamp" property of the SLog object

clear.name: clear
clear.description:
Access the "clear" property of the SLog object.
This specify if the previous logs have to be cleared before printing this one

temp.name: temp
temp.description:
Access the "temp" property of the SLog object.
This specify if this log is a temporary one and if it has to be deleted
when the next log appear.

as.name: as
as.description:
Access the "as" property of the SLog object.
This specify the optimal way the log has to be displayed.
This depends on the logger you use and how it can display logs.

@coffeekraken.s-images-builder.node.sIma.name: SImagesBuilder
@coffeekraken.s-images-builder.node.sIma.description:
This class allows you to compress the more popular images formats like
"png", "jpg", "svg", "gif", etc... using the WONDERFULL sharp library.

glob.description: Specify a glob pattern relative to the "inDir" to target images you want to process

inDir.description: Specify the absolute path to the folder where your images stands

outDir.description: Specify the absolute path to the folder you want to save your images. "inDir" folder structure is kept.

quality.description: Specify the quality percentage you want to target without the "%" sign

webp.description: Specify if you want to generate ".webp" versions of your images or not

width.description: Specify the maximum width you want to target for your images

height.description: Specify the maximum height you want to target for your images

resolution.description: Specify some resolutions you want to generate. The targeted "width" and "height" is considered as the resolution 1 and all others resolutions are declined from this

clear.description: Specify if you want to clear the "outDir" before generate new images or not

specificParams.description: Allows you to specify some custom params depending on folder globs like "myCoolFolder/*.jpg" used as object property. Override every settings you want in this new object for the specified folder(s)

@coffeekraken.s-handlebars.node.register.name: registerHelpers
@coffeekraken.s-handlebars.node.register.description:
This function allows you to register all the helpers provided in this package
directly on your handlebars instance.

@coffeekraken.s-handlebars.node.helpers..name: configFileNameFromDocmapPath
@coffeekraken.s-handlebars.node.helpers..description: This helper allows you to get the .config file name from a passed docmap path

@coffeekraken.s-handlebars.node.helpers..name: configFiles
@coffeekraken.s-handlebars.node.helpers..description: This helper allows you to get the SFile object representation of each config files that correspond to the passed configId

@coffeekraken.s-handlebars.node.helpers..name: configFromDocmap
@coffeekraken.s-handlebars.node.helpers..description: This helper allows you to extract from the passed docmap some config

@coffeekraken.s-handlebars.node.helpers..name: configValue
@coffeekraken.s-handlebars.node.helpers..description: This helper allows you to "sanitize" some configuration values makes absolute paths to relative, etc...

@coffeekraken.s-handlebars.node.helpers..name: get
@coffeekraken.s-handlebars.node.helpers..description: This helper allows you to get get a value deep into the passed object using dotpath syntax

@coffeekraken.s-handlebars.node.helpers..name: ifEqual
@coffeekraken.s-handlebars.node.helpers..description: This represent the `match` handlebars helper that allows you to execute a passed regex on the passed string

@coffeekraken.s-handlebars.node.helpers..name: ifMatch
@coffeekraken.s-handlebars.node.helpers..description: This represent the `match` handlebars helper that allows you to execute a passed regex on the passed string

@coffeekraken.s-handlebars.node.helpers..name: islicense
@coffeekraken.s-handlebars.node.helpers..description: This helper allows you to make an conditional check if a license is specified in your package.json file

@coffeekraken.s-handlebars.node.helpers..name: jsonStringify
@coffeekraken.s-handlebars.node.helpers..description: This helper allows you to stringify an object

@coffeekraken.s-handlebars.node.helpers..name: rootRelative
@coffeekraken.s-handlebars.node.helpers..description: This helper allows you to remove in a path the absolute part and get only the relative part of it

@coffeekraken.s-handlebars.node.helpers..name: sfile
@coffeekraken.s-handlebars.node.helpers..description: This helper allows you to get an SFile instance back from the passed file path

@coffeekraken.s-docblock.shared.sDockblo.name: SDockblock
@coffeekraken.s-docblock.shared.sDockblo.description:
This is the main class that expose the methods like "parse", etc...
You have to instanciate it by passing a settings object. Here's the available options:

sort.name: sort
sort.description:
This method allows you to set the order in which you want to get the
blocks back when using the methods like get blocks, etc...

parse.name: parse
parse.description:
This method is the principal one. Use it to parse a string
and get back the object version of it

toObject.name: toObject
toObject.description: This method convert the parsed docblocks to a simple object

toString.name: toString
toString.description: This method allows you to get the string version of the docblock(s)

@coffeekraken.s-docblock.shared.sDocbloc.name: SDocblockBlock
@coffeekraken.s-docblock.shared.sDocbloc.description:
This class represent a docblock object that contains all the "tags" values and some features like:
- Converting the block to markdown
- More to come...

tagsMap.name: tagsMap
tagsMap.description: Store the default tags mapping to their parsing functions

registerTag.name: registerTag
registerTag.description:
This static method allows you to register a new tag that will
be recognized by the SDocblockBlock class.

toString.name: toString
toString.description: This method return the passed source string

toObject.name: toObject
toObject.description: This method return the parsed docblock object

@coffeekraken.s-date-picker-component.js.name: Date Picker
@coffeekraken.s-date-picker-component.js.description:
This component specify a date picker. It uses under the hood the **AMAZING pikaday library** with some additional features like
sugar theming support as well as some events and more.
Almost all the pikaday options are available through properties. Check out the api documentation for more details...

example.code:
<label class="s-label s-mb--30">
     Min and max date
     <s-date-picker
         placeholder="Select a date"
         class="s-width--50"
         min-date="2021-08-10"
         max-date="2021-08-20"
         name="myDatePicker2"
     ></s-date-picker>
</label>

<label class="s-label s-mb--30">
     Min and max date
     <s-date-picker
         placeholder="Select a date"
         class="s-color:accent\:deep s-width--50"
         min-date="2021-08-10"
         max-date="2021-08-20"
         name="myDatePicker2"
     ></s-date-picker>
</label>

<label class="s-label s-mb--30">
    Disable weekends
    <s-date-picker
        placeholder="Select a date"
        class="s-color:complementary\:deep s-width--50"
        name="myDatePicker3"
        disable-weekends
    ></s-date-picker>
</label>

<label class="s-label s-mb--30">
    RTL support
    <s-date-picker
        placeholder="Select a date"
        class="s-color:accent\:deep s-width--50"
        min-date="2021-08-10"
        name="myDatePicker1"
        rtl
    ></s-date-picker>
</label>

<label class="s-label s-mb--30">
    Display more than 1 month
    <s-date-picker
        placeholder="Select a date"
        class="s-color:success\:deep s-width--50"
        name="myDatePicker4"
        number-of-months="2"
    ></s-date-picker>
</label>

<label class="s-label s-mb--30">
    Custom calendar icon
    <s-date-picker
        placeholder="Select a date"
        class="s-color:error\:deep s-width--50"
        name="myDatePicker5"
        calendar-icon="<?xml version='1.0' encoding='iso-8859-1'?>
<svg version='1.1' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' xmlns:xlink='http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink' x='0px' y='0px' viewBox='0 0 488.901 488.901' style='enable-background:new 0 0 488.901 488.901;' xml:space='preserve'><g><g><g><path fill='currentColor' d='M468.9,56.1h-76.2v-36c0-10.6-9.5-20.1-20.1-20.1s-20.1,8.5-20.1,20.1v36H136.6v-36c0-10.6-9.5-20.1-20.1-20.1
		S96.4,8.5,96.4,20.1v36H20.1C9.5,56.1,0,64.6,0,76.2v392.6c0,10.6,8.5,20.1,20.1,20.1h329.1c5.3,0,9.5-1.1,13.8-5.3l119.6-111.1
		c4.2-4.2,6.3-9.5,6.3-14.8V76.2C489,65.6,480.5,56.1,468.9,56.1z M40.2,96.3h408.5v241.3H348.2c-10.6,0-20.1,8.5-20.1,20.1v91
		H40.2V96.3z M417.7,377.8l-48.4,44.6v-44.6H417.7z'/></g><path fill='currentColor' d='M286.3,256.1c8.7-9.8,13.9-22.7,13.9-36.8c0-30.7-25-55.7-55.7-55.7s-55.7,25-55.7,55.7c0,14.1,5.3,27,13.9,36.8
	c-13,11.6-21.2,28.4-21.2,47.1c0,34.7,28.3,63,63,63s63-28.3,63-63C307.5,284.5,299.3,267.7,286.3,256.1z M244.5,198.6
	c11.4,0,20.7,9.3,20.7,20.7s-9.3,20.7-20.7,20.7s-20.7-9.3-20.7-20.7S233.1,198.6,244.5,198.6z M244.5,331.3
	c-15.4,0-28-12.6-28-28s12.6-28,28-28s28,12.6,28,28S259.9,331.3,244.5,331.3z'/></g></g><g></svg>"
    ></s-date-picker>
</label>

firstDay.description: Specify the first day of the week. 0 is sunday, 1 monday, etc...

minDate.description: the minimum/earliest date that can be selected (this should be a native Date object - e.g. new Date() or moment().toDate())

maxDate.description: the maximum/latest date that can be selected (this should be a native Date object - e.g. new Date() or moment().toDate())

disableWeekends.description: disallow selection of Saturdays or Sundays

yearRange.description: number of years either side (e.g. 10) or array of upper/lower range (e.g. [1900,2015])

rtl.description: reverse the calendar for right-to-left languages

i18n.description: language defaults for month and weekday names

events.description: array of dates that you would like to differentiate from regular days (e.g. ['Sat Jun 28 2017', 'Sun Jun 29 2017', 'Tue Jul 01 2017',])

webcomponent.name: webcomponent
webcomponent.description:
This function allows you to define (register) your webcomponent with some default
props if needed.

@coffeekraken.s-color-picker-component.j.name: Color Picker
@coffeekraken.s-color-picker-component.j.description:
This component specify a color picker. It uses under the hood the **AMAZING Pickr library** with some additional features like
sugar theming support as well as some events and more.
Almost all the Pickr options are available through properties. Check out the api documentation for more details...

@coffeekraken.s-code-example-component.j.name: Code Example
@coffeekraken.s-code-example-component.j.description: This component represent a code example that make sure your passed code(s) is displayed well using under the hood the AMAZING [highlightjs](https://highlightjs.org/) library.

example.code:
<s-code-example>
     <template lang="js">
function $initHighlight(block, cls) {
try {
  if (cls.search(/\bno\-highlight\b/) != -1)
    return process(block, true, 0x0F) +
           ` class="${cls}"`;
} catch (e) {
}
for (var i = 0 / 2; i < classes.length; i++) {
  if (checkCondition(classes[i]) === undefined)
    console.log('undefined');
}
     </template>
</s-code-example>

active.description: Specify which "tab" is active in case of multiple languages examples

toolbar.description: Specify what you want in the toolbar. Currently available item is "copy"

toolbarPosition.description: Specify the toolbar position. Can be "content" or "nav"

languages.description: Specify some languages that you want to support. Must be "[key]: language" object syntax. See [highlight.js doc](https://github.com/highlightjs/highlight.js/blob/main/SUPPORTED_LANGUAGES.md) for supported languages

lines.description: Specify how many lines to display at max

more.description: Specify if you want to expand the more feature at start or not

@coffeekraken.s-bench.shared.sBench.name: SBench
@coffeekraken.s-bench.shared.sBench.description:
This class allows you to perform some simple benchmarking actions
like dividing a process into multiple "steps" and track the timing
between these, etc...

env.name: env
env.description: Access the SBenchEnv object to check activated bench, etc...

benchEnv.name: benchEnv
benchEnv.description:
This static method allows you to get the current bench environment
the process is running in. The bench environment

getBenchInstanceById.name: getBenchInstanceById
getBenchInstanceById.description:
This static method allows you to get back a current SBench instance by it's id,
or get back a new instance that you can use directly

start.name: start
start.description: This method allows you to start a new bench "session"

step.name: step
step.description:
This method allows you to declare a new step in your bench.
A step is simple a point in your code like "after compilation", etc.
It will keep track of each steps and display the time it has taken
from the last step.

end.name: end
end.description: This method allows you to end a bencvh "session"

isBenchActive.name: isBenchActive
isBenchActive.description: This method allows you to check if a particular bench id is active

isActive.name: isActive
isActive.description: This method allows you to check if the current bench is active or not.

toString.name: toString
toString.description: This method allows you to print the bench in string format

@coffeekraken.s-bench.shared.sBenchEnv.name: SBenchEnv
@coffeekraken.s-bench.shared.sBenchEnv.description:
This class allows you to access the SBench environment parameters like:
- the current process want some bench?
- which bench are activated
- some methods to check if for example the bench "request" is wanted

activateBench.name: activateBench
activateBench.description: This method allows you to activate one or more bench in the current process

activeBench.name: activeBench
activeBench.description: This method allows you to get back the list of activated bench(s)

isBenchActive.name: isBenchActive
isBenchActive.description: This method allows you to check if a particular bench id is active

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.js.dom.que.name: querySelectorLive
@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.js.dom.que.description:
Observe the dom to get all the elements that matches a passed css selector at any point in time.
Be warned that this use the mutation observer API and will monitor all the document for new nodes. Make sure to use it
when you don't have the chance to use the custom elements API instead

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.css..description:

The `destyle` one is well known and you can find the documentation on their website.
The `sugar` one is our own that add some resets like setting max-width to 100% for images, and some more. Check our his own documentation page.

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.css..name: Fit Sizes
@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.css..description:
These classes allows you to apply a fit size on any HTMLElement.
On image and video, uses `object-fit` property, on all others,
simply fill the element using an absolute position, top: 0, left: 0 and width/height: 100%.

example.code:
fill fit size

cover fit size

contain fit size

none fit size

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.css..name: s-fit:fill
@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.css..description: This class allows you to apply a "<yellow>fill</yellow>" fit size to any HTMLElement. Work best on images and videos

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.css..name: s-fit:cover
@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.css..description: This class allows you to apply a "<yellow>cover</yellow>" fit size to any HTMLElement. Work best on images and videos

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.css..name: s-fit:contain
@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.css..description: This class allows you to apply a "<yellow>contain</yellow>" fit size to any HTMLElement. Work best on images and videos

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.css..name: s-fit:none
@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.css..description: This class allows you to apply a "<yellow>none</yellow>" fit size to any HTMLElement. Work best on images and videos

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.css..name: Format text
@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.css..description:
This class allows you to apply some formatting to pure HTMLElement that are scoped into.
For example, a simple `ul` tag will be styled as if the `s-list:ul` class would be applied on it
when it is scoped inside the `s-format:text` class.
This feature has to be implemented using the `@sugar.format.text` mixin on the elements you
want to support the text formatting.

example.code:
Text format

Chris Parker

Asperiores sunt id molestias mollitia.

  • Elmer Gleason
  • Arnold Gerhold
  • Jacob Lindgren
Quasi ea itaque beatae vel provident aliquam deserunt tempore rerum. Fuga aut vero aliquam itaque dicta maxime. Suscipit alias assumenda id.
Hello World
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit
  1. Leon Langworth III
  2. Shaun Lueilwitz
  3. Amber VonRueden

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.css..name: Rhythm vertical
@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.css..description:
This class allows you to apply some margins to make space between direct childs.
This feature has to be implemented using the `@sugar.rhythm.vertical` mixin on the elements you
want to support the rhythm vertical.

example.code:
Rhythm vertical

Jill Block

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.css..name: Text
@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.css..description:
These classes allows to apply some text styling like `text-align: left`, `text-align: right`, `text-decoration: underline`, etc...
directly inside your HTML.

example.code:
Aligns

(left) Christina Hilpert
(right) Kay Zulauf
(center) Sylvia Lang
(start) Glen Auer
(end) Terence Klein

Decorations

(overline) Alfred Reichel
(underline) Ismael Olson
(line-through) Stephen Cormier

Transforms

(lowercase) Sabrina Yost
(uppercase) Oliver Corwin
(capitalize) Shaun McCullough

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.css..name: Depth

These depths are defined in the theme configuration under `theme.depth` namespace.

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.css..name: Disabled
@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.css..description:
These classes allows you to apply the disabled style on any HTMLElement.
This make sure *no pointer events** stays active as well as displaying the **not-allowed cursor**.

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.css..name: Scale
@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.css..description:
These classes allows to apply a scale to any supported UI elements.
This scale does not use the transform property but increase actual values like `padding`,
`margin`, etc... In fact, all the properties setted with the `sugar.scallable` function.
It's usually a good practice to set the `font-size` of your UI element to `sugar.scalable(1rem)`
and then to set inner values using `em` unit.

example.code:

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.css..name: s-scale:10
@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.css..description:
This class allows you to apply a "<yellow>10</yellow>" scale style to any HTMLElement.
Note that this scale is not applied using the "transform" property but it will scale
all the properties that uses the function "sugar.scalable" to set his value.

example.code:
I'm a cool title

I'm a cool scaled title

since 2.0.0

@coffeekraken.coffeekraken-io.sugar.css..description:
These classes represent all the icons that you have listed in your project using the `@sugar.icon.classes` mixin.
By using this mixin, your icons will be accessible using the same `s-icon:{name}` classes
independently of the icon source that can be *Fontawesome** or your **Filesystem**.
These providers are the one that we support for now but others can be added if needed.

docmap.name: Range
docmap.description:
This component specify a range with some additional features that the native one like
displaying the value automatically in tooltip or inline.

example.code:
import { webcomponent as SRangeWebcomponent } from '@coffeekraken/s-range-component';
SRangeWebcomponent();

name.description: Specify the name to assign to the internal input[type="range"]

min.description: Specify the minimal value or the range

max.description: Specify the maximal value of the range

step.description: Specify the steps between each values

target.description: Specify a css selector of any HTMLElement or HTMLInputElement in which to inject the value when the range is updated

tooltip.description: Specify if you want to display the value inside a tooltip on top of the thumb

webcomponent.name: webcomponent
webcomponent.description:
This function allows you to define (register) your webcomponent with some default
props if needed.

For now, you can validate data types like `string`, `number` or  `boolean` with options like `email`,
`date`, `greater`, `less`, `min`, `max`, and a lot more.

docmap.name: Date Picker
docmap.description:
This component specify a date picker. It uses under the hood the **AMAZING pikaday library** with some additional features like
sugar theming support as well as some events and more.
Almost all the pikaday options are available through properties. Check out the api documentation for more details...

example.code:
<label class="s-label s-mb--30">
     Min and max date
     <s-date-picker
         placeholder="Select a date"
         class="s-width--50"
         min-date="2021-08-10"
         max-date="2021-08-20"
         name="myDatePicker2"
     ></s-date-picker>
</label>

<label class="s-label s-mb--30">
     Min and max date
     <s-date-picker
         placeholder="Select a date"
         class="s-color:accent\:deep s-width--50"
         min-date="2021-08-10"
         max-date="2021-08-20"
         name="myDatePicker2"
     ></s-date-picker>
</label>

<label class="s-label s-mb--30">
    Disable weekends
    <s-date-picker
        placeholder="Select a date"
        class="s-color:complementary\:deep s-width--50"
        name="myDatePicker3"
        disable-weekends
    ></s-date-picker>
</label>

<label class="s-label s-mb--30">
    RTL support
    <s-date-picker
        placeholder="Select a date"
        class="s-color:accent\:deep s-width--50"
        min-date="2021-08-10"
        name="myDatePicker1"
        rtl
    ></s-date-picker>
</label>

<label class="s-label s-mb--30">
    Display more than 1 month
    <s-date-picker
        placeholder="Select a date"
        class="s-color:success\:deep s-width--50"
        name="myDatePicker4"
        number-of-months="2"
    ></s-date-picker>
</label>

<label class="s-label s-mb--30">
    Custom calendar icon
    <s-date-picker
        placeholder="Select a date"
        class="s-color:error\:deep s-width--50"
        name="myDatePicker5"
        calendar-icon="<?xml version='1.0' encoding='iso-8859-1'?>
<svg version='1.1' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' xmlns:xlink='http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink' x='0px' y='0px' viewBox='0 0 488.901 488.901' style='enable-background:new 0 0 488.901 488.901;' xml:space='preserve'><g><g><g><path fill='currentColor' d='M468.9,56.1h-76.2v-36c0-10.6-9.5-20.1-20.1-20.1s-20.1,8.5-20.1,20.1v36H136.6v-36c0-10.6-9.5-20.1-20.1-20.1
		S96.4,8.5,96.4,20.1v36H20.1C9.5,56.1,0,64.6,0,76.2v392.6c0,10.6,8.5,20.1,20.1,20.1h329.1c5.3,0,9.5-1.1,13.8-5.3l119.6-111.1
		c4.2-4.2,6.3-9.5,6.3-14.8V76.2C489,65.6,480.5,56.1,468.9,56.1z M40.2,96.3h408.5v241.3H348.2c-10.6,0-20.1,8.5-20.1,20.1v91
		H40.2V96.3z M417.7,377.8l-48.4,44.6v-44.6H417.7z'/></g><path fill='currentColor' d='M286.3,256.1c8.7-9.8,13.9-22.7,13.9-36.8c0-30.7-25-55.7-55.7-55.7s-55.7,25-55.7,55.7c0,14.1,5.3,27,13.9,36.8
	c-13,11.6-21.2,28.4-21.2,47.1c0,34.7,28.3,63,63,63s63-28.3,63-63C307.5,284.5,299.3,267.7,286.3,256.1z M244.5,198.6
	c11.4,0,20.7,9.3,20.7,20.7s-9.3,20.7-20.7,20.7s-20.7-9.3-20.7-20.7S233.1,198.6,244.5,198.6z M244.5,331.3
	c-15.4,0-28-12.6-28-28s12.6-28,28-28s28,12.6,28,28S259.9,331.3,244.5,331.3z'/></g></g><g></svg>"
    ></s-date-picker>
</label>

firstDay.description: Specify the first day of the week. 0 is sunday, 1 monday, etc...

minDate.description: the minimum/earliest date that can be selected (this should be a native Date object - e.g. new Date() or moment().toDate())

maxDate.description: the maximum/latest date that can be selected (this should be a native Date object - e.g. new Date() or moment().toDate())

disableWeekends.description: disallow selection of Saturdays or Sundays

yearRange.description: number of years either side (e.g. 10) or array of upper/lower range (e.g. [1900,2015])

rtl.description: reverse the calendar for right-to-left languages

i18n.description: language defaults for month and weekday names

events.description: array of dates that you would like to differentiate from regular days (e.g. ['Sat Jun 28 2017', 'Sun Jun 29 2017', 'Tue Jul 01 2017',])

docmap.name: Color Picker
docmap.description:
This component specify a color picker. It uses under the hood the **AMAZING Pickr library** with some additional features like
sugar theming support as well as some events and more.
Almost all the Pickr options are available through properties. Check out the api documentation for more details...

docmap.name: Code Example
docmap.description: This component represent a code example that make sure your passed code(s) is displayed well using under the hood the AMAZING [highlightjs](https://highlightjs.org/) library.

example.code:
<s-code-example>
     <template lang="js">
function $initHighlight(block, cls) {
try {
  if (cls.search(/\bno\-highlight\b/) != -1)
    return process(block, true, 0x0F) +
           ` class="${cls}"`;
} catch (e) {
}
for (var i = 0 / 2; i < classes.length; i++) {
  if (checkCondition(classes[i]) === undefined)
    console.log('undefined');
}
     </template>
</s-code-example>

active.description: Specify which "tab" is active in case of multiple languages examples

toolbar.description: Specify what you want in the toolbar. Currently available item is "copy"

toolbarPosition.description: Specify the toolbar position. Can be "content" or "nav"

languages.description: Specify some languages that you want to support. Must be "[key]: language" object syntax. See [highlight.js doc](https://github.com/highlightjs/highlight.js/blob/main/SUPPORTED_LANGUAGES.md) for supported languages

lines.description: Specify how many lines to display at max

more.description: Specify if you want to expand the more feature at start or not

docmap.name: Global reset
docmap.description:
These mixins allows you to apply some resets like `destyle` and/or the `sugar` one.
The `destyle` one is well known and you can find the documentation on their website.
The `sugar` one is our own that add some resets like setting max-width to 100% for images, and some more. Check our his own documentation page.

docmap.name: Destyle reset
docmap.description: These mixins allows you to apply the `destyle` reset easily.

docmap.name: Sugar reset
docmap.description: These mixins allows you to apply the `sugar` reset easily.

docmap.name: Format text

This class allows you to apply some formatting to pure HTMLElement that are scoped into.
For example, a simple `ul` tag will be styled as if the `s-list:ul` class would be applied on it
when it is scoped inside the `s-format:text` class.
This feature has to be implemented using the `@sugar.format.text` mixin on the elements you
want to support the text formatting.

docmap.name: Icons
docmap.description:
These classes represent all the icons that you have listed in your project using the `@sugar.icon.classes` mixin.
By using this mixin, your icons will be accessible using the same `s-icon:{name}` classes
independently of the icon source that can be *Fontawesome** or your **Filesystem**.
These providers are the one that we support for now but others can be added if needed.

docmap.name: Global reset
docmap.description:
These mixins allows you to apply some resets like `destyle` and/or the `sugar` one.
The `destyle` one is well known and you can find the documentation on their website.
The `sugar` one is our own that add some resets like setting max-width to 100% for images, and some more. Check our his own documentation page.

docmap.name: Destyle reset
docmap.description: These mixins allows you to apply the `destyle` reset easily.

docmap.name: Sugar reset
docmap.description: These mixins allows you to apply the `sugar` reset easily.

docmap.name: Format text
docmap.description:
This class allows you to apply some formatting to pure HTMLElement that are scoped into.
For example, a simple `ul` tag will be styled as if the `s-list:ul` class would be applied on it
when it is scoped inside the `s-format:text` class.
This feature has to be implemented using the `@sugar.format.text` mixin on the elements you
want to support the text formatting.

docmap.name: Icons
docmap.description:
These classes represent all the icons that you have listed in your project using the `@sugar.icon.classes` mixin.
By using this mixin, your icons will be accessible using the same `s-icon:{name}` classes
independently of the icon source that can be *Fontawesome** or your **Filesystem**.
These providers are the one that we support for now but others can be added if needed.

docmap.name: Range
docmap.description:
This component specify a range with some additional features that the native one like
displaying the value automatically in tooltip or inline.

example.code:
import { webcomponent as SRangeWebcomponent } from '@coffeekraken/s-range-component';
SRangeWebcomponent();

name.description: Specify the name to assign to the internal input[type="range"]

min.description: Specify the minimal value or the range

max.description: Specify the maximal value of the range

step.description: Specify the steps between each values

target.description: Specify a css selector of any HTMLElement or HTMLInputElement in which to inject the value when the range is updated

tooltip.description: Specify if you want to display the value inside a tooltip on top of the thumb

docmap.name: Date Picker
docmap.description:
This component specify a date picker. It uses under the hood the **AMAZING pikaday library** with some additional features like
sugar theming support as well as some events and more.
Almost all the pikaday options are available through properties. Check out the api documentation for more details...

example.code:
<label class="s-label s-mb--30">
     Min and max date
     <s-date-picker
         placeholder="Select a date"
         class="s-width--50"
         min-date="2021-08-10"
         max-date="2021-08-20"
         name="myDatePicker2"
     ></s-date-picker>
</label>

<label class="s-label s-mb--30">
     Min and max date
     <s-date-picker
         placeholder="Select a date"
         class="s-color:accent\:deep s-width--50"
         min-date="2021-08-10"
         max-date="2021-08-20"
         name="myDatePicker2"
     ></s-date-picker>
</label>

<label class="s-label s-mb--30">
    Disable weekends
    <s-date-picker
        placeholder="Select a date"
        class="s-color:complementary\:deep s-width--50"
        name="myDatePicker3"
        disable-weekends
    ></s-date-picker>
</label>

<label class="s-label s-mb--30">
    RTL support
    <s-date-picker
        placeholder="Select a date"
        class="s-color:accent\:deep s-width--50"
        min-date="2021-08-10"
        name="myDatePicker1"
        rtl
    ></s-date-picker>
</label>

<label class="s-label s-mb--30">
    Display more than 1 month
    <s-date-picker
        placeholder="Select a date"
        class="s-color:success\:deep s-width--50"
        name="myDatePicker4"
        number-of-months="2"
    ></s-date-picker>
</label>

<label class="s-label s-mb--30">
    Custom calendar icon
    <s-date-picker
        placeholder="Select a date"
        class="s-color:error\:deep s-width--50"
        name="myDatePicker5"
        calendar-icon="<?xml version='1.0' encoding='iso-8859-1'?>
<svg version='1.1' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' xmlns:xlink='http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink' x='0px' y='0px' viewBox='0 0 488.901 488.901' style='enable-background:new 0 0 488.901 488.901;' xml:space='preserve'><g><g><g><path fill='currentColor' d='M468.9,56.1h-76.2v-36c0-10.6-9.5-20.1-20.1-20.1s-20.1,8.5-20.1,20.1v36H136.6v-36c0-10.6-9.5-20.1-20.1-20.1
		S96.4,8.5,96.4,20.1v36H20.1C9.5,56.1,0,64.6,0,76.2v392.6c0,10.6,8.5,20.1,20.1,20.1h329.1c5.3,0,9.5-1.1,13.8-5.3l119.6-111.1
		c4.2-4.2,6.3-9.5,6.3-14.8V76.2C489,65.6,480.5,56.1,468.9,56.1z M40.2,96.3h408.5v241.3H348.2c-10.6,0-20.1,8.5-20.1,20.1v91
		H40.2V96.3z M417.7,377.8l-48.4,44.6v-44.6H417.7z'/></g><path fill='currentColor' d='M286.3,256.1c8.7-9.8,13.9-22.7,13.9-36.8c0-30.7-25-55.7-55.7-55.7s-55.7,25-55.7,55.7c0,14.1,5.3,27,13.9,36.8
	c-13,11.6-21.2,28.4-21.2,47.1c0,34.7,28.3,63,63,63s63-28.3,63-63C307.5,284.5,299.3,267.7,286.3,256.1z M244.5,198.6
	c11.4,0,20.7,9.3,20.7,20.7s-9.3,20.7-20.7,20.7s-20.7-9.3-20.7-20.7S233.1,198.6,244.5,198.6z M244.5,331.3
	c-15.4,0-28-12.6-28-28s12.6-28,28-28s28,12.6,28,28S259.9,331.3,244.5,331.3z'/></g></g><g></svg>"
    ></s-date-picker>
</label>

firstDay.description: Specify the first day of the week. 0 is sunday, 1 monday, etc...

minDate.description: the minimum/earliest date that can be selected (this should be a native Date object - e.g. new Date() or moment().toDate())

maxDate.description: the maximum/latest date that can be selected (this should be a native Date object - e.g. new Date() or moment().toDate())

disableWeekends.description: disallow selection of Saturdays or Sundays

yearRange.description: number of years either side (e.g. 10) or array of upper/lower range (e.g. [1900,2015])

rtl.description: reverse the calendar for right-to-left languages

i18n.description: language defaults for month and weekday names

events.description: array of dates that you would like to differentiate from regular days (e.g. ['Sat Jun 28 2017', 'Sun Jun 29 2017', 'Tue Jul 01 2017',])

docmap.name: Code Example
docmap.description: This component represent a code example that make sure your passed code(s) is displayed well using under the hood the AMAZING [highlightjs](https://highlightjs.org/) library.

example.code:
<s-code-example>
     <template lang="js">
function $initHighlight(block, cls) {
try {
  if (cls.search(/\bno\-highlight\b/) != -1)
    return process(block, true, 0x0F) +
           ` class="${cls}"`;
} catch (e) {
}
for (var i = 0 / 2; i < classes.length; i++) {
  if (checkCondition(classes[i]) === undefined)
    console.log('undefined');
}
     </template>
</s-code-example>

active.description: Specify which "tab" is active in case of multiple languages examples

toolbar.description: Specify what you want in the toolbar. Currently available item is "copy"

toolbarPosition.description: Specify the toolbar position. Can be "content" or "nav"

languages.description: Specify some languages that you want to support. Must be "[key]: language" object syntax. See [highlight.js doc](https://github.com/highlightjs/highlight.js/blob/main/SUPPORTED_LANGUAGES.md) for supported languages

lines.description: Specify how many lines to display at max

more.description: Specify if you want to expand the more feature at start or not
